candidates.body:
- use cached data sources & combined sql requests for efficient sql querying (in my manual testing w/ explain analyze it introduced no additional load)

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

- **New Features**

candidates.title: feat(multi): uniformly distribute addresses for quick search
candidates.body:
* `addresses` search category now includes only non-token rows.
* Add chain whitelist for quick search.
* Quick search for `addresses` category now returns exactly one result per chain from whitelist.
* Add validation for chain id parameters from external service endpoints.

candidates.title: fix(eth-bytecode-db): bump verification common to support empty constructor arguments
feat(multi): multichain active chains fix
candidates.body: * `only_active` chains now returns all known chains from both `marketplace` and `contracts-info` services.

candidates.title: feat(verifier): implement verifier-alliance based verification approach
feat(multi): add only_active filter to /chains
candidates.body: * Add `only_active` optional filter to `/chains` endpoint to return chains which have active API key(s).

candidates.title: feat(verifier)!: remove middleware from verifier
candidates.body: Remove middleware from verifier as we've noticed we are not using it anywhere. Remove sig-provider-extension middleware from the server code

candidates.title: feat(multi): multichain service optimizations
candidates.body:
* Remove `RETURNING` clause from entity batch update functions.
* Add an optional DB replica support which is used to separate search queries from intense batch updates, which could slow down user-facing endpoints.
* Optimize `addresses` search query (read code comments for details).

candidates.title: fix(vyper): verify vyper contracts with integrity hash inside creation code
candidates.body: `is_vyper` part is mostly hardcoded because I will probably rewrite this part during contract verification approach update in the nearest PRs

candidates.title: feat(eth-bytecode-db): integrate verifier_alliance schema v1
candidates.body:
Closes https://github.com/blockscout/blockscout-rs/issues/1108

Integrates updated `verifier-alliance-migration`, `verifier-alliance-entity` and `verifier-alliance-database` crates to integrate v1 alliance schema into eth-bytecode-db service

Changes left to the next PRs:
1. `check_match_statuses` function (validating that inserted verification data is not worse than existing ones) was removed in this PR, and will be returned later into `verifier-alliance-database` crate.
2. Integration verifier alliance tests checking authorization scenarios have been commented out and will be re-written in the PR updating tests structure


<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

## Summary by CodeRabbit

Based on the comprehensive summary, here are the updated release notes:

- **New Features**
	- Added support for Verifier Alliance database testing framework.
	- Enhanced contract verification and matching capabilities.
	- Introduced new client methods for batch importing Solidity contracts.
	- New asynchronous functions for retrieving verified contracts and contract deployments.

- **Improvements**
	- Streamlined contract deployment and verification processes.
	- Updated database connection and configuration handling.
	- Improved error handling and logging for contract verification.
	- Enhanced date-time handling capabilities.
	- Added new macro for JSON handling in tests.

- **Changes**
	- Refactored module structure for verifier alliance functionality.
	- Updated dependency management and import paths.
	- Simplified contract matching and transformation logic.
	- Transitioned to a more modular approach in testing.

- **Removed**
	- Deprecated several verifier alliance-related modules and test cases.
	- Removed legacy versioned dependencies.
	- Eliminated unused functions and structures related to contract verification.
	- Removed several outdated test cases and helper structures.

- **Testing**
	- Added new integration test infrastructure.
	- Enhanced test case management for contract verification.
	- Improved test database isolation and setup mechanisms.
	- Updated JSON handling in test cases for consistency.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

candidates.title: feat(user-ops-indexer): rewrite to alloy
candidates.body:
Rewrite `user-ops-indexer` to use `alloy-rs` exclusively instead of deprecated `ethers-rs`

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit


- **New Features**
  - Added a new environment variable for tracing transactions.
  - Enhanced API response structures with clearer definitions for various response types.

- **Bug Fixes**
  - Updated handling of addresses and hashes to ensure compatibility with the new library.

- **Documentation**
  - Updated README and Swagger documentation to reflect changes in environment variables and API response structures.

- **Refactor**
  - Transitioned from `ethers` to `alloy` library for various functionalities, improving type safety and modularity.
  - Streamlined indexer logic and connection handling.
  - Updated various function signatures and internal logic to accommodate new types.
  - Introduced new error handling mechanisms and parsing traits for page tokens.

- **Chores**
  - Removed several unnecessary dependencies to streamline the project.

<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
